issue.title: [C++] Run Gandiva tests in Travis CI
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-3382](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-3382). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
Integrate and test Gandiva-Cpp in travis. This would unblock new PRs to gandiva.

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-3382?focusedCommentId=16635366) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
Might make sense to have a single CI entry that runs the Gandiva tests both for C++ and JAva

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-3382?focusedCommentId=16636481) by Pindikura Ravindra (Pindikura Ravindra):*
sure `[~wesmckinn]`. but, the java build is dependant on cpp build for gandiva. so, we want to get the cpp build and tests running first.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-3382?focusedCommentId=16636610) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
Of course. What I meant was running the Gandiva tests in a new CI entry since the current C++ CI entry is getting a bit large

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-3382?focusedCommentId=16639266) by Pindikura Ravindra (pravindra):*
thanks @wesm - there are a bunch of compiler warnings. I'm fixing them.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-3382?focusedCommentId=16640741) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
